pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:0.5.eng: 60. The training rule on hiding robes

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sattarasavaggiyā bhikkhū asannihitaparikkhārā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.2.eng: On one occasion when the monks from the group of seventeen had not put away their requisites,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.3.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū sattarasavaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ pattampi cīvarampi apanidhenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.3.eng: the monks from the group of six hid their bowls and robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.4.eng: The monks from the group of seventeen said to them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.6.eng: The monks from the group of six laughed, but the monks from the group of seventeen cried.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.9.pli: “Ime, āvuso, chabbaggiyā bhikkhū amhākaṃ pattampi cīvarampi apanidhentī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.9.eng: “’Cause the monks from the group of six have hidden our bowls and robes.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.10.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.10.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.11.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū bhikkhūnaṃ pattampi cīvarampi apanidhessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.11.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six hide the bowls and robes of other monks?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.12.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pattampi cīvarampi apanidhethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.12.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.15.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, bhikkhūnaṃ pattampi cīvarampi apanidhessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.15.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.17.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.17.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.18.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā nisīdanaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ vā kāyabandhanaṃ vā apanidheyya vā apanidhāpeyya vā, antamaso hasāpekkhopi, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:1.18.1.eng: ‘If a monk hides a monk’s bowl, robe, sitting mat, needle case, or belt, or he has it hidden, even just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.8.eng: there are two kinds of bowls: iron bowls and ceramic bowls.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.10.pli: channaṃ cīvarānaṃ aññataraṃ cīvaraṃ, vikappanupagaṃ pacchimaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.10.eng: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be assigned to another.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.10.comm: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see Kd 8:3.1.6. According to Kd 8:21.1.4 the size referred to is no smaller than 8 by 4 sugataṅgula, “standard fingerbreadths”. For an explanation of the idea of vikappanā, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.12.eng: one with a border is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.16.eng: there are two kinds of belts: those made from strips of cloth and those made from pigs’ intestines.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.18.eng: if he hides it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.20.eng: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.21.pli: Sakiṃ āṇatto bahukampi apanidheti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.1.21.eng: If he only asks once, then even if the other hides many things, he commits one offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.1.pli: Upasampanne upasampannasaññī pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā nisīdanaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ vā kāyabandhanaṃ vā apanidheti vā apanidhāpeti vā, antamaso hasāpekkhopi, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.1.eng: If the other monk is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he hides his bowl or robe or sitting mat or needle case or belt, or he has it hidden, even just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.2.eng: If the other monk is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he hides his bowl or robe or sitting mat or needle case or belt, or he has it hidden, even just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.3.pli: upasampanne anupasampannasaññī pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā nisīdanaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ vā kāyabandhanaṃ vā apanidheti vā apanidhāpeti vā, antamaso hasāpekkhopi, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.3.eng: If the other monk is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he hides his bowl or robe or sitting mat or needle case or belt, or he has it hidden, even just for a laugh, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.4.pli: Aññaṃ parikkhāraṃ apanidheti vā apanidhāpeti vā, antamaso hasāpekkhopi, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.4.eng: If he hides another requisite, or he has it hidden, even just for a laugh, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.5.pli: Anupasampannassa pattaṃ vā cīvaraṃ vā aññaṃ vā parikkhāraṃ apanidheti vā apanidhāpeti vā, antamaso hasāpekkhopi, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.5.eng: If he hides the bowl or robe or other requisite of someone who is not fully ordained, or he has it hidden, even just for a laugh, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.6.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.7.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.2.8.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.2.eng: if he is not aiming to have fun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.3.eng: if he puts away what has been improperly put away;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.4.eng: if he puts something away with the thought, “After giving a teaching, I’ll give it back;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.7.eng: The training rule on hiding robes, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc60:2.3.8.eng: The sixth subchapter on drinking alcohol is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:0.4.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī issāso hoti, kākā cassa amanāpā honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.2.eng: At that time Venerable Udāyī was skilled in archery. And because he disliked crows,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.3.pli: So kāke vijjhitvā vijjhitvā sīsaṃ chinditvā sūle paṭipāṭiyā ṭhapesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.3.eng: he shot them. He cut off their heads and then set them out in a row impaled on stakes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.8.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.8.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.9.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropessatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.9.eng: “How can Venerable Udāyī intentionally kill living beings?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.10.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.10.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.13.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropessasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.13.eng: “Foolish man, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.15.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.15.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.16.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu sañcicca pāṇaṃ jīvitā voropeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:1.16.1.eng: ‘If a monk intentionally kills a living being, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.6.eng: knowing, perceiving, having intended, having decided, he transgresses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.8.eng: an animal is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.10.pli: jīvitindriyaṃ upacchindati uparodheti santatiṃ vikopeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.1.10.eng: if he cuts off and makes an end of the life faculty, if he destroys its continuity, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.1.pli: Pāṇe pāṇasaññī jīvitā voropeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.1.eng: If it is a living being, and he perceives it as such, and he kills it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.2.pli: Pāṇe vematiko jīvitā voropeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.2.eng: If it is a living being, but he is unsure of it, and he kills it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.3.eng: If it is a living being, but he does not perceive it as such, and he kills it, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.4.eng: If it is not a living being, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.5.eng: If it is not a living being, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.2.6.eng: If it is not a living being, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.5.eng: if he is not aiming at death;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.7.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc61:2.3.8.eng: The training rule on intentionally, the first, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:0.4.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:0.5.eng: 62. The training rule on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ paribhuñjanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.2.eng: the monks from the group of six were using water that they knew contained living beings.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.3.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.3.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ paribhuñjissantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.4.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six use water that they know contains living beings?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.5.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ paribhuñjathā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.5.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.8.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ paribhuñjissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.8.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.10.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.10.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.11.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ sappāṇakaṃ udakaṃ paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:1.11.1.eng: ‘If a monk uses water that he knows contains living beings, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassa ārocenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.1.6.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.1.7.pli: “Sappāṇakan”ti jānanto, “paribhogena marissantī”ti jānanto paribhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.1.7.eng: If he uses it, knowing that it contains living beings and knowing that they will die if the water is used, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.1.eng: If it contains living beings, and he perceives it as such, and he uses it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.2.eng: If it contains living beings, but he is unsure of it, and he uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.3.eng: If it contains living beings, but he does not perceive it as such, and he uses it, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.4.eng: If it does not contain living beings, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.5.eng: If it does not contain living beings, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.2.6.eng: If it does not contain living beings, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.2.eng: if he does not know that it contains living beings;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.3.eng: if he knows that it does not contain living beings;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.4.eng: if he uses it knowing that they will not die;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.6.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc62:2.3.7.eng: The training rule on containing living beings, the second, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:0.4.eng: The subchapter on containing living beings

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihatādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.2.eng: At that time the monks from the group of six were reopening a legal issue that they knew had been legitimately settled, saying,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.3.pli: “akataṃ kammaṃ dukkaṭaṃ kammaṃ puna kātabbaṃ kammaṃ anihataṃ dunnihataṃ puna nihanitabban”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.3.eng: “The legal procedure hasn’t been done;” “It’s been done badly;” “It should be done again;” “It hasn’t been settled;” “It’s been badly settled;” “It should be settled again.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.3.comm: The Pali appears as a single sentence enclosed in quotes. Yet it is hard to see how this could have been spoken in one go, since some of the constituent clauses are mutually contradictory. For instance, the same legal procedure cannot have been both not done and badly done. I therefore take it that the individual clauses were spoken at different times. This method of putting together a number of independent utterances into a single quote is in fact quite common in the Vinaya Piṭaka. In most such cases I separate out the individual quotes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.4.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.4.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihatādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭessantī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.5.eng: “How can the monks from the group of six reopen a legal issue that they know has been legitimately settled?” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihatādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you’re doing this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihatādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.9.eng: “Foolish men, how can you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.11.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.12.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihatādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:1.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk reopens a legal issue that he knows has been legitimately settled, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti, aññe vā tassa ārocenti, so vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.6.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him or the Sangha has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.6.comm: The meaning of the last of these three ways of knowing, so vā āroceti, is not clear. CPD suggests: “sa (sā) āroceti (?). Perhaps this last form is conformable to sa. ārocayate med. caus. in the meaning: he or she makes inquiries (of others).” However, this does not fit with the parallel usage at Bu Pc 29:3.1.6 where the text says that she tells (sā vā āroceti) him, presumably referring to the nun telling the monk. In this case āroceti cannot refer to the monk making inquiries. The commentaries are silent, and I therefore assume that a straightforward meaning is the most likely one. I would suggest, then, that it refers to the Sangha, or perhaps one of the monks who participated in the saṅghakamma, having told him directly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.8.pli: dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena kataṃ, etaṃ yathādhammaṃ nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.8.eng: done according to the Teaching, according to the Monastic Law, according to the Teacher’s instruction—this is called “legitimately”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.10.pli: cattāri adhikaraṇāni— vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.10.eng: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.12.pli: “akataṃ kammaṃ dukkaṭaṃ kammaṃ punakātabbaṃ kammaṃ anihataṃ dunnihataṃ puna nihanitabban”ti ukkoṭeti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.1.12.eng: if he reopens it, saying, “The legal procedure hasn’t been done;” “It’s been done badly;” “It should be done again;” “It hasn’t been settled;” “It’s been badly settled;” “It should be settled again,” he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.1.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, and he reopens it, he commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.2.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, and he reopens it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.3.eng: If it is a legitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as illegitimate, and he reopens it, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.4.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he perceives it as legitimate, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.5.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.2.6.eng: If it is an illegitimate legal procedure, and he perceives it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.3.2.pli: “adhammena vā vaggena vā na kammārahassa vā kammaṃ katan”ti jānanto ukkoṭeti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.3.2.eng: if he reopens it because he knows that the legal procedure was illegitimate, done by an incomplete assembly, or done against one who did not deserve it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.3.4.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pc63:2.3.5.eng: The training rule on reopening, the third, is finished.
